pros: It was fun working with the kids and brainstorming ideas on how they can spend their time building friendships at the summer camp.
cons: Because of Covid-19, I believe that registrations were rushed and disorganized, and that things could have been handled differently. However, it was worked out, and the rest of the summer went smoothly.

pros: 1. Many holidays off and solid PTO time 2. Great coworkers

pros: very accepting and easy to navigate

pros:
- Get a job quickly as a teenager
- Pays minimum page
- Good experience for your resume
cons: - Not a lot of communication, I email them but they don't reply much

job_title: Youth Specialist in West Chester, OH
cons: On call, bad attitudes, poor management

pros: The regular workers support each other so much! But.. they kinda have to do that b/c of the toxic amount of overwork. Then there's the mission, everyone is totally motivated to help kids <3 ... but like, it would be nice for that not to be an excuse for why the company doesn't respect their workers =/ The job flexibility is great tho!
cons: DO NOT work here if you are openly LGBT, they treat them very meanly and make their lives difficult. Also probably not anyone with a disability. I've heard lots of people complain that FoY bullies or takes advantage of the fact they have needs and stuff. The managers never listen to feedback, and just generally treat employees poorly. I think people are afraid of challenging them b/c they treat people who speak up like they're the problem. SMH We all love these kids so much and don't want to mess that up, but it's not great TBH

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Chester, OH
pros: I've worked here for a few years now, and I love this place. The feeling of being a part of a team and knowing you are doing good for children and families is great.
cons: Seeing the bad parts of society in the history of the children we care for is hard.
only for one month, or 4 weeks

pros: Great people as well as environment!

job_title: Summer Camp Counselor in Hamilton, ON
pros: I got to meet new friends and work with kids, I enjoyed cooking and playing games with the kids. My favourite part was when the kids drew me pictures.
cons: I’d say the only con about working here was that it was a summer only job, I would’ve loved to work with the kids full time.

pros:

- you get to go on field trips w the kids, ttc tickets provided
- coworkers were cool people
cons:

- not really much of a leadership role, unless you take initiative
